intro: Cyperorchis eburnea, commonly known as the ghost orchid, is a rare and elusive orchid species native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its pale, almost translucent flowers that resemble ghostly apparitions, hence its common name. The plant typically grows on decaying wood in moist, shaded environments, often in swampy or wetland areas. Its roots are adapted to absorb nutrients from the decomposing organic matter in its habitat. Cyperorchis eburnea is a member of the Orchidaceae family and is known for its unique morphology and ecological niche.
